This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: mydrive.ch
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://www.mydrive.ch/browse](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.mydrive.ch%2Fbrowse) ### Comment > This cloud storage website, even though I have a "premium" subscription, flicks through their product portfolio every 12 seconds or so in the bottom left corner, which is very distracting while concentrating on working on files in the center of the screen. Since it is only visible while logged-in, I've made two screenshots with one being uBlock's rule generator, to see the path of the images. The number in brackets changes every 12 seconds by images being rotated, with the rule "www.mydrive.ch##.softronics-products" I was able to hide the banner without further breakage. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/tSlk9YF.jpg)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/TazK57g.png)

comment.body:
@Alex-302 I've run into the same issue as described by me above back in 2020, this time though on the "sister website" `www.mystorbox.de`. It is a carbon copy of `mydrive.ch` (only differing in the domain and the server location), including the mentioned "self-promotion slideshow" on the left hand side of the screen. The filter rule you've added for `mydrive.ch` still works as intended over there, so it probably could be re-used for this site as well.

![mystorbox](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23747593/228426598-64e84584-cab1-41a3-b67d-254ace850a96.JPG)

comment.body:
Maybe need convert rule to user script (to cover uBo fans by TamerMonkey/ViolentMonkey) or uBo custom scriptlet (without second WebExtension).

It's unlikely that anyone will spend several days figuring out how to use, for example, `set-constant` 
 to fool the site into thinking that we don't give consents.

AdGuard may in the future rewrite this into its delayed-click scriptlet, so it won't need to be added to AdGuard Extra. The uBo in that case will have to wait to see if the simulate-event-poc (https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uBlock-issues/issues/2229) will be in the uBo available to all and if not if they will make an exception to close on one Luxembourg site with rejection of consents.

o.savecall.de

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Self-destruction of first-party cookies, Disable cache for third-party requests, Block Push API, Block Location API, Hide Referrer from third-parties (specify in comment below, if used custom value), Mask your IP address (specify in comment below, if used custom value), Protect from DPI

Usable in Mails for tracking the times opend and watched (For users using services like Gmail in  the Webinterface a danger)
